tuv.seg: • Joining the European Union
• Bheith mar bhall den Aontas Eorpach
• Leaving the European Union
• An tAontas Eorpach a fhágáil
The European Union (EU) is a political and economic union of certain countries in Europe
Aontas polaitiúil agus eacnamaíochta tíortha faoi leith san Eoraip é Aontas na hEorpa

Since July 2013, there are 28 member states in the European Union: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Italy, Ireland, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, the Netherlands, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Spain, Slovakia, Slovenia, Sweden and the United Kingdom

Ó Iúil 2013 tá 28 Ballstáit ann: An Bheilg, An Ghearmáin, An Fhrainc, An Iodáil, Lucsamburg, An Ísiltír, An Danmhairg, An Ghréig, An Spáinn, Éire, An Ostair, An Phortaingéil, An Fhionlainn, An tSualainn, An Ríocht Aontaithe, An Phólainn, An Ungáir, An Laitvia, An Liotuáin, An tSlóibhéin, Poblacht na Slóvaice, Poblacht na Seice, An Eastóin, An Chipir, Málta, an Bhulgáir, an Rómáin agus an Chróit
The EU has grown out of 3 communities founded after World War II to establish peace and prosperity in Europe
D'fhás Aontas na hEorpa as trí chomhphobal a bunaíodh i ndiaidh an dara Chogaidh Domhanda le síocháin agus rathúnas a bhunú san Eoraip
The European Coal and Steel Community was set up in 1951, the European Atomic Energy Commission was founded in 1957 and the European Economic Community was also founded in 1957
Bunaíodh i 1951 Aontas Guail agus Cruach na hEorpa, i 1957 bunaíodh Coimisiún um Fhuinneamh Adamhach na hEorpa agus bunaíodh freisin i 1957 Comhphobal Eacnamaíochta na hEorpa
The fundamental laws of the EU are set out in the various treaties agreed and ratified by the member states
Tá bundlíthe Aontas na hEorpa leagtha síos sna conarthaí éagsúla a d'aontaigh agus a dhaingnigh na Ballstáit
A treaty is ratified when it is formally accepted by the member state
Tá conradh daingnithe nuair atá glactha go foirmiúil leis ag Ballstát
The most important treaty is the Treaty of Rome, which created the European Economic Community in 1957
Conradh na Róimhe an conradh is tábhachtaí, a cruthaigh Comhphobal Eacnamaíochta na hEorpa i 1957

Since the Treaty of Rome, the following treaties have been agreed and ratified by all the Member States: the Merger Treaty in 1967, the Single European Act in 1986, the Treaty on European Union (the Maastricht Treaty) in 1992, the Treaty of Amsterdam in 1997, the Treaty of Nice in 2002 and the Treaty of Lisbon in 2009

Ó glacadh le Conradh na Róimhe, d'aontaigh agus daingnigh na Ballstáit cúig chonradh eile; Conradh Cumaisc i 1967, An Ionstraim Eorpach Aonair i 1986, Conradh ar an Aontas Eorpach (Conradh Maastricht) i 1992, Conradh Amstardaim i 1997, Conradh Nice i 2002 agus an Conradh Liospóin sa bhliain 2009
The European Union has 4 main aims:
Tá roinnt aidhmeanna ag Aontas na hEorpa:
• To establish European citizenship
• Saoránacht na hEorpa a bhunú
This means protection of fundamental human rights and freedoms
Cosaint a dhéanamh ar bhunchearta daonna agus saoirsí
• To ensure freedom, security and justice
• Saoirse, slándáil agus ceart a chinntiú
This means co-operation in the field of justice and home affairs
Ciallaíonn seo comh-oibriú i réimse cearta agus gnóthaí baile
• To promote economic and social progress
• Dul chun cinn eacnamaíochta agus sóisialta a chothú
This involves the single market, the euro, environmental protection and social and regional development
Aonmhargadh, an euro, cosaint timpeallachta agus forbairt sóisialta agus réigiúnda atá i gceist anseo
• To assert Europe's role in the world
• Ról na hEorpa sa domhan a bhaint amach
The European Union is run by 5 main institutions:
Tá cúig phríomh institiúid ag riaradh Aontas na hEorpa:
• The Council of the European Union
• Comhairle Aontas na hEorpa
Joining the European Union
Bheith mar bhall den Aontas Eorpach
Under Article 49 of the Treaty on European Union any European country may apply for membership if it respects the democratic values of the EU and is committed to promoting them

Faoi Airteagal 49 den Chonradh ar an Aontas Eorpach, féadfaidh aon tír Eorpach iarratas a dhéanamh ar bhallraíocht má léiríonn sí meas ar luachanna daonlathacha an AE agus má tá sí tiomanta do na luachanna siúd a chur chun cinn

A country wishing to join the EU submits a membership application to the Council of the European Union which asks the European Commission to assess the applicant’s ability to meet the conditions for membership (Copenhagen criteria)

Seolann tír ar mian léi bheith mar bhall den AE iarratas ar bhallraíocht chuig Comhairle an Aontais Eorpaigh a iarrann ar an gCoimisiún Eorpach chun measúnú a dhéanamh ar chumas an iarratasóra chun na coinníollacha le haghaidh ballraíochta (critéir Chóbanhávan) a chomhlíonadh
If the Commission’s opinion is positive, the Council of the European Union must then agree upon a negotiating mandate
Má bhíonn tuairim dhearfach ag an gCoimisiún, ní mór do Chomhairle aon Aontais Eorpaigh comhaontú ansin ar idirbheartaíocht a dhéanamh ar shainchúram
Negotiations are then formally opened
Ansin déantar idirbheartaíochtaí a oscailte go foirmiúil
Information on the steps towards joining is available on the European Commission’s website
Tá faisnéis ar na céimeanna i dtreo bheith mar bhall ar fáil ar láithreán gréasáin an Choimisiúin Eorpaigh
Leaving the European Union
An tAontas Eorpach a fhágáil
Under Article 50 of the Treaty on European Union any member state may decide to withdraw from the EU
Faoi Airteagal 50 den Chonradh ar an Aontas Eorpach, féadfaidh aon bhallstát an cinneadh a dhéanamh chun aistarraingt ón AE
The member state must notify the European Council of its intention
Ní mór don bhallstát an Chomhairle Eorpach a chur ar an eolas ar a rún
The EU must negotiate an agreement with the member state, setting out the arrangements for its withdrawal, taking account of the framework for its future relationship with the EU
Ní mór don AE comhaontú a dhéanamh leis an mballstát, ina leagtar amach na socruithe dá aistarraingt, agus aird á tabhairt ar an gcreat don chaidreamh a bheidh aige amach anseo leis an AE
The agreement is negotiated in accordance with Article 218(3) of the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union
Déantar idirbheartaíocht ar an gcomhaontú i gcomhréir le hAirteagal 218(3) den Chonradh ar Fheidhmiú an Aontais Eorpaigh

The agreement is concluded on behalf of the EU by the Council of the European Union, if it has the approval of a qualified majority of the member states, not including the member state that is leaving
Tugann Comhairle an Aontais Eorpaigh an comhaontú chun críche thar ceann an AE, má bhíonn faomhadh faighte aici ó thromlach cáilithe na mballstát, gan an ballstát atá ag fágáil a áireamh
The qualified majority must be at least 72% of the members of the Council of the European Union and representing at least 65% of the population of the member states
Ní mór gurb ionann an tromlach cáilithe agus ar a laghad 72% de chomhaltaí Chomhairle an Aontais Eorpaigh agus a dhéanann ionadaíocht do 65%, ar a laghad, de dhaonra na mballstát

The EU treaties cease to apply to the member state from the date of entry into force of the withdrawal agreement or, if there is no agreement, 2 years after the original notification unless the European Council unanimously decides to extend this period. On 23 June 2016, the United Kingdom (UK) voted to leave the EU

Cuirtear deireadh le feidhm chonarthaí an AE i dtaca leis an mballstát ón dáta a chuirtear an comhaontú aistarraingthe i bhfeidhm nó, murar baineadh aon chomhaontú amach, 2 bhliain i ndiaidh gur tugadh an fógra tosaigh mura gcinneann an Chomhairle Eorpach d’aon ghuth chun an tréimhse seo a shíneadh
Europe Direct is a free telephone and e-mail service that provides information about the EU
Soláthraíonn Europe Direct seirbhís ghutháin agus ríomhphoist shaor in aisce ar féidir le saoránaigh í a úsáid le freagraí a fháil ar cheisteanna a d’fhéadfadh a bheith acu i leith an AE
It offers information on a wide range of subjects including legislation, policies, institutions, programmes and the rights of EU citizens
Tairgeann sí eolas faoi raon leathan ábhar lena n-áirítear reachtaíocht, beartais, forais, cláir agus cearta shaoránaigh an AE
It can also refer users to the best source of advice at EU, national, regional and local levels
Féadann sé úsáideoirí a tharchur freisin chuig an bhfoinse is fearr comhairle ag leibhéil an AE, go náisiúnta, go réigiúnach agus go háitiúil
There are a number of Europe Direct local information centres in Ireland
Tá líon ionaid faisnéise áitiúla Europe Direct in Éirinn
